Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: What are the formats that are supported? You mention %g and %cb, but are there others? And what do they even mean? :)

Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment:
Can you move this into src/print_wireless_info.c please?

Also mark it static.

Also format it so that it’s consistent with the rest of the code

Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: In general, what’s your use case for this? Why isn’t the existing printed bitrate good enough?

Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: Hm, shouldn’t we support %g, %cb (and others if they exist) in the format_up string instead of having two format strings?

Author: Enrico Carlesso
Comment: Hi Michael. The reason is pretty simple. I've recently switched to a dual band wireless router, so my speed changes frequently and typical values with %g are: 96, 130, 166.6 and so on. This change the length of the text in my bar, and it distracts me a lot, so I've switched to %5.1f.

Author: Enrico Carlesso
Comment: Sure, I was putting this here because I was thinking to use it in eth speed, but it's a different story there.

Author: Enrico Carlesso
Comment: Should I provide a new complete patch in this case?

Author: anonymous
Comment: Yes, please submit a new patch. It’d also be good to list your use case as an example in the documentation so that people know how to use that feature.
